Description: Reconstructed (from twenty-four fragments) South Ionian pottery cup with everted rim; interior: on rim, dilute lines between black bands; glazed black on body save for reserved tondo with black circles; top of lip glazed; exterior: lip and handle zone reserved with band between; lower wall glazed with one reserved band; handles glazed; inscription on exterior.
Type series: Vallet and Villard Ionian Cup Type B3 (possibly)
Curator's comments: Although Schlotzhauer (Schlotzhauer 2012) does not discuss this piece, it does find parallels with his South Ionian cups with everted rim Type 9C. Type 9C cups correspond to Attic Siana or Gordion cups and find parallels with Hayes' Ionian Cup Type X (Boardman and Hayes 1966, 111-116) and Vallet and Villard's Ionian Cup type B3 (Vallet and Villard, 1964, 87-88). The Type 9 shape evolved from the earlier Type 5 cup shape. Type 5 cups are rare at Naukratis whereas there are numerous examples of Type 9 cups. Both types were common drinking vessels found in Greeks sanctuaries, including the sanctuary of Aphrodite at Miletus.
Bibliographic references: Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 692, no. 494)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.725) (Phase 3)
